intro: Microtropis latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved microtropis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
